item.title: Report E-2024120240
item.description:
Report E-2024120240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading drums noticed one drum had a puncture hole in it. A bolt from another drum lid hit the drum and punctured the drum body during transportation. The drum with the puncture hole was put in an overpack and the spill was cleaned in house and nothing leaked out of containment or through the box truck floor.

item.title: Report E-2024120241
item.description:
Report E-2024120241

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-14
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When we received 1 drum from label specialties it was determined that the flash point of the material was <140F but the material shipped not a hazardous waste. We set up a hazardous waste stream for the customer to receive the drum and processed that drum as hazardous waste and issued a hazardous waste manifest for the shipment.

item.title: Report E-2024120231
item.description:
Report E-2024120231

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver was pulled over by local PD informing him that there was liquid leaking. The driver found that liquid was leaking out around the rear valve. The Driver then put down some absorbent and the driver tightened up the bolt around the valve stopping the release. There was a team dispatched out to address the material that was released. The team showed up at 1930et and put down mor absorbents and began cleaning up the material. The crew cleaned up the accessible material and was then disposed of in the proper manor. They were done with the initial clean up at 2045et. The material that soaked into the ground will require a permit and further equipment to be able to address. We are still trying to get the permit from the state to complete.

item.title: Report E-2024120209
item.description:
Report E-2024120209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncturing the pail. The material was Ultra 7000 U7209. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120159
item.description:
Report E-2024120159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 50-gallon paper bag due to the bag being ripped against a piece of metal in the trailer. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum and placed the remaining product into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120157
item.description:
Report E-2024120157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 20-gallon poly drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum being cracked. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The overpack was placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
